website_summaries.verdict: A strong option for those looking for a little extra support in a comfortable boot.
pros: This great-looking choice offers two things that you generally don’t see together in a boot: comfort and great support
The waterproofing right out of the box also gets high marks
cons: Some buyers report that the waterproofing and the boot itself fail after extended use
It is recommended to buy up a half-size

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoes, sole is falling apart after 2 hikes.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are super comfy, true to size, Goretex worked fine, the feet sweat much less than I would expect from such shoe. Overall I was extremely happy with the shoes during the 2 trips I made. The problem is that the sole started to fall apart, pieces of it just fell off - see attached photos. Contacted Vasque, waiting for their response.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but definitely NOT WATERPROOF!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort and feel of these boots. I bought them because I'm on my feet most of the day working the homestead. We've got a fair amount of land, wooded area, a workshop and a garden that all need tending. I was looking for something lightweight, sturdy and waterproof. I got two out of three. The Mantra 2.0 Gore-Tex is advertised as being waterproof, but they don't even keep out the morning dew. Very disappointed on that account.
customer_reviews.author: Aerie Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit & Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I have difficulty finding hiking shoes made for wide feet. Vasque not only carries wide sizes, they are known for quality. I am usually reluctant about buying shoes on the internet, but I already owned a pair of Vasque shoes, so I knew if I ordered this pair the size would be correct. I will be going on a trip to Arizona shortly where I will do a lot of hiking. These shoes required no break-in period for me and I am looking forward to wearing them on the trip
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Bad tread design resulting in frequent slippage.
customer_reviews.text: I think these are terrible shoes. The tread is illogically designed and doesn't grip well. I've worn them under all kinds of conditions and they are a lousy all around field shoe. Also, when they get wet they expand resulting in a shoe that gets larger over time. Last year I slipped along a river wearing these shoes and broke my ankle. I have nothing good to say about this shoe. I'd be interested in knowing if others have slipped and been injured while wearing this shoe, since I think a class action law suit would be possible. Note: I am a very experienced hiker and have experience with all kinds of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ron S.

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Tevas for similar price
customer_reviews.text: I know there are some boots out there that are even more expensive, but this boot is as good as investment as I choose to make. I wanted boots that are going to last a lot longer than the cheap Big 5 sale boots that last me barely a year. This is my second pair from Vasque, and they are supportive, sturdy, and I am on target for ordering 1 size bigger and it being a perfect fit. The only semi negative thing I can say is that they are a bit heavy as a trade off for their support
customer_reviews.author: R. Salchak

customer_reviews.title: Has become my preferred shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I very serious looked for a couple months for a shoe to take on my first UK trip. I trie don every type of hiker you can find in most shoe stores. I can't buy Vasques locally, and after reading many reviews I tried Amazon's due to it's great return policy on clothing. The break in period didn't take too long and they worked perfect from downtown London to the Scottish Highlands. They are not too hot in the summer and provide enough protection in the winter. I also purchased another Vasque running type shoe and I prefer these. If this set wears out, I'll buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a quality hiking shoe in wide widths
customer_reviews.text: The low-top biking shoes in width W fit perfectly with plenty of room in the toe box, unlike the vast majority of shoes in this category. Anything other than D width are hard to find in Goretex with Vibram soles. These will work perfectly for an upcoming 2 1/2 week trip through Scotland. The smooth leather will clean up easier than suede versions to. The color is a greenish-gray which looks fine with most any apparel.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Factory seconds, and not due to cosmetic reasons
customer_reviews.text: Left shoe had some raised rubber on the insole which rubbed, was returned, and replaced, this pair also is now showing the same uncomfortable issue after three months or so, as the insole begins to compress the raised rubber edge feels more prominent, it feels like a factory over mold on the outside of the insole on the ball of my left foot. New insoles have offered some relief, but not all. I now find myself refraining from wearing them because they are uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tollie P.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: 1) I have a narrow foot, and my actual size is 7.75 to 8.0 -- I wear Nike shoes in a size 8.5, fit perfect 2) The Vasque web site states these are made for narrow feet -- they are correct, they fit perfect 3) However I thought they might be just a shade short and wanted to try a size 8.5.. Waste of time as they were a full size longer and much wider. 4) After wearing these now for over a month and sometimes 6 + hours at a time I love them -- GREAT SHOE for a narrow foot 5) And yes I discovered they are NOT to short after wearing them
customer_reviews.author: Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Verse Scree let it be
customer_reviews.text: I came from the scree 2.0, which was top notch for me because of the support. That shoe is discontinued and I searched vasque's entire product line for a solid replacement. Enter the mantra 2.0 gtx. While this shoe is way better looking and with a lot more breathability, it lacks comparable support in the upper area of the foot, heal and ankle. It is not by any means sub par, and certainly beats 80% of other shoes I've tried, but it isn't at the same level of support as the scree. Excellent shoe, extremely comfortable, great arch support, strong sole. You can't go wrong with this shoe. Buy true to size, though the toe box is a little tight.
customer_reviews.author: Xiouco

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: The color is much darker than shown in the ad. With the gore-tex, they may be too warm in hot weather. I have hiked quite a lot in the non-goretex version and they are great, with very good support for a shoe. I have troublesome feet and have finally found a hiking shoe for me. The tongue on my old ones was made too short (not a deal killer), but on these the tongue are longer and better.
customer_reviews.author: Dux

customer_reviews.title: The good thing that came from this is that I had ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run narrow. The good thing that came from this is that I had my feet remeasured and found that "D" is not where I am now. I am an "E" size. However, though I am returning these, I do want to be fair and say that the little bit of inside walking gave me the impression that these are really good soles on this shoe. That and the fact that they look great. I would purchase them without hesitation if not for my clunky feet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Order half size larger to save your toes!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this same shoe except without goretex 3 years ago and they are the best shoes I have ever owned. Some people recommend ordering a half size bigger, but on my first pair I did not do that and they were a perfect fit. So this time I order my correct size again, 10.5, but this time my toes are hitting the end of the shoe. Maybe the added goretex makes the inside dimension a little smaller.I do not know the reason but I don't think these will be good for hiking the mountains. I wished I had ordered a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: T. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks hiking shoe. Just right.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who often feels like they're right between normal and wide shoe sizes, these fit perfectly. Feet can breathe a little bit (room for thick socks) but not swimming around of wearing regular socks. Only worn them today for a couple mile walk but so far, like them a whole lot more than previous timberland and other brands of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: DANGER:  Slippery when wet!
customer_reviews.text: These shows look great and fit fine, but they are dangerous for hiking. I live in a moist mountain area and the soles have NO grip on rocks that are wet or have any algae on them. Even knowing their poor performance on moist surfaces and walking carefully I have slipped uncontrollably and fallen 3 times. Shame on Vibram for making a sole like this for hiking shoes, shame on Vasque for using such a sole. I've had them to long to return, so I must throw them away to prevent injury to myself or anyone I would give them to.
customer_reviews.author: MADMAB

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and Minimal Sole Cushion
customer_reviews.text: There's not much cushion in the sole, so don't expect much comfort in that regard. More importantly, though, is the weird noise the shoe makes (just the one, mind you!) when walking indoors. It didn't start immediately, but rather about 2 weeks in. I returned the first pair for this reason, and foolishly requested a replacement pair. On the second pair, the noise didn't start until about 4 weeks in, but now it's non-stop. It's like a suction cup noise when walking on carpeting or flooring, which can be quite irritating. And it only happens with the right shoe, same as last pair. Weird. Nice looking shoes, though, so kind of a shame they aren't made better.
customer_reviews.author: Asphyxia 8

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with these shoes, I have trouble finding good fitting shoes and these were close to perfect for me. Some folks said these shoes were warm - or 2 hot but for me they're perfect. not to hot, not too cold. I will say they did start out a bit stiff and they do take a bit of breaking in but they're my go to shoes now. green color is nice 2.
customer_reviews.author: »ßålåñçæ«

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Shoe 2 months ago and use them practically everyday for work in Landscape/Lawn Care industry and I’m very impressed with the rugged sturdiness and relative waterproof qualities of this shoe. I wear wide shoes and it was a selling point for it and it fits great. Very comfortable to walk in and made of good materials with no break downs after almost 3 months of use. Will definitely get another pair when I need to replace them
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones you’re looking for
customer_reviews.text: I waited to post the review. Been wearing these now for a few months and they’re my favorite Vasques yet. I’ve worn them almost daily as part of my commute and walks with the dog. The waterproofing is excellent without over heating you’re feet. They’ve handled rain, mud, snow, the NYC subway system and everything else perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this for my husband. I rely on reviews for my purchases, so I always leave reviews for what I buy. My husband loves these shoes but won’t spend the time writing a review. His old favorite were Danner’s zigzag trail low tops for work shoes. They stopped making them a few years ago and he loves these more than those. Super comfortable, don’t make your feet hot, waterproof and they look good. Okay I added the last part, he would wear ugly shoes if they were comfortable... as a women pain is beauty!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Had an older pair of these hiker that lasted for many years. Great soles, and the waterproofing was great. After many years they were starting to fall apart. I wanted Vasque because the last pair was so good. So far everything is great. Fits great. Perfect for AT hiking. That what I mainly got them for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Something quite not right
customer_reviews.text: Something doesn’t fit right with these shoes. I’ve purchased Vasque’s before and loved them. Unfortunately, I thought it was just a bit tight and needed to be broken in. Was having major bottom of the foot pain. Bought a new pair of shoes and these went to the trash. I may have gotten a defect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Once again Vasque is the shoe for rugged outdoor use. There is no other that is truly waterproof in extreme conditions like this shoe. It may get some water eventually in it but it seems to breathe it out as you go along. Walking across wet snow all day is it's only downfall. With low top gaitors it is pretty much dry and comfortable in wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Bike4mee

customer_reviews.title: Narrow but solid
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide short foot. I can take a large 8.5e, but usually they are a hair short so I normally do well with a 9 regular which might be a hair large but nothing I can't handle with an insert. I originally tried a 9m with this shoe which was way too narrow. The 9e fits well enough but is a little on the long side. Otherwise a great shoe, a little warm on the get over 85deg. Solid, high quality materials and work.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cox

customer_reviews.title: Very Dry and Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Feet are always dry--in heat when sweat instantly evaporates--and in wet cold, when exterior moisture is treacherous. I am poor and, if you are going to have one pair of shoes, these are the ones to have. Have had ankle-boot model for over ten years and they still function as well as first day and after constant extremely heavy, abusive use. In this model, specially designed Vibram sole protects foot from what would otherwise be bruising, highly uneven rocky surfaces. Great for running or hiking through deep rocky woods and for wearing on city streets.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I returned these shoes because they are too narrow, even in a wide width. Nice shoes, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Fitzgibbon

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Vasque boots are my preferred hiking/backpacking shoes - super high quality, durable (my last pair lasted 20 years), and a comfortable fit. If you want to step into an elite pair of hiking shoes, I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Miller

customer_reviews.title: Well made comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I tried several brands of hiking shoes before finding these. They are comfortable, and appear to be well made and sturdy. The laces go through wide loops which take just a bit more time to snug up. But the end result is that the shoe feels very good when laced up. I don't think there will be much required to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot, bad shipping.
customer_reviews.text: The Hiking boot is good, I would buy again.I have only tried them for a few days. No complaints on the boots. Shipping to me from USPS left a lot to be desired. The box was light weight and did not hold up for shipping, Neither did their wrap cover from USPS. The box cannot be used for storage, which I usually do. That's why no five rating.
customer_reviews.author: Avak

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Men's Mantra 2.0 Gore-Tex Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: Still in the break in stage with them. Started using them last week. I have already rack over 40 miles on them. This shoes are very comfortable: No hot spots and even though is Gore Tex..does not generate much sweat at all. Although, I have to admit was surprise to see that with such a rugged sole it does NOT gives you a good grip on wet sidewalk surfaces....Be careful!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like these boots but they weren't for me
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these boots but they weren't for me. The materials are quality and the arch was comfortable. I returned because in one shoe no matter how tight I tied the laces my heal would slip inside the shoe. It got annoying. I probably got a bad shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty hiking shoes in a compact package
customer_reviews.text: With the full leather upper, these aren't the lightest hiking shoe out there, but they support and protect your feet almost as well as a good hiking boot, provide good traction on granite, plus they come in widths (I need a 2E), offer gore-tex water proofing and are long-wearing. It's getting a little boring, but I am mulling my 3rd pair in a row. They are a tad short so I use a half-size bigger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Wythoff

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes, but they are not as well made as I had hoped. I purchased these for a long camping trip in the mountains where terrain was often tough. As talked up as these shoes are, several seams are loose and the sole easily came loose in areas. That said, aside from these issues they are good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort in a wide body style....
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well on my wide foot. Comfortable and just heavy enough to support/protect without being klunky. Excellent laces! Single knots stay in all day. I'll probably buy another pair as it seems that every pair of shoes I love gets discontinued and replaced with a model that just isn't as good as the older one. (I'M LOOKING AT YOU, NEW BALANCE)
customer_reviews.author: K9 Gromit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Isle Royals hikers
customer_reviews.text: My second pair. Actually replacing some inferior Merrill’s I got on sale. Great vibram no slip sole and FTC to boot. Not as tough as my sundowners but lighter. Should be god for another three seasons then retired to yard duty.
customer_reviews.author: lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous !! Extremely slippery on any wet surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe, built with water-resistant goretex lining, to use it on rainy days, but it's so slippery to be impossible to use on wet ground. A nice shape and quality materials wasted in a senseless coupling.
customer_reviews.author: Pep

customer_reviews.title: Bought for husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband complained of his hips and back hurting every night so I decided to buy some expensive work shoes for him. It's very difficult to purchase shoes without trying them on, especially for another person! I bought slightly larger, since he usually wears a 12, but his feet seem to have gotten bigger lately. He wasn't sure about them at first, stating that the soles seemed too hard. The most telling evidence, though, is that he hasn't complained about his back, hips or feet since starting to wear them. Kudos - I think we have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so I’m guessing that my first pair were pretty much “W” after miles of wear
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after my first pair wore out after 3 years, and I purchased the same size except “wide” instead of medium because that’s what was on sale. The new pair feels exactly the same, so I’m guessing that my first pair were pretty much “W” after miles of wear. All my hiking footwear run 1 size larger than my street shoes, and Vasque is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Does not breathe
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the waterproof ones. The regular Mantra 2's were some of the best shoes I've had. The fit, grip, and durability were fantastic. These were a loss as I dont wear them. They have no ventilation and cause overheating in all temperatures. I would not buy these again and would happily send mine back for the classic Mantra 2's.
customer_reviews.author: Ziyad Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Vasque has everyone else beat IMO
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were to replace my old pair (same shoe essentially) 10 years ago. Bought my very first pair in 1994, working in Yosemite, hiked 12 miles the next day. Super well made, uncompromising grip, super comfortable, 0 break in time needed. They work great out of the box, my 10 year old pair is still super solid, just no longer waterproof. I have taken them MANY amazing places, can’t wait to test out these new ones on a long haul! LOVE Vasque
customer_reviews.author: Michelle dorfi

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Had several trail hiking choices in the cart. Really glad I picked these Haven't experienced the waterproofing yet, but they are the most supportive and comfortable hikers I have owned, and I'm a big guy. Fit is perfect...a true 11 1/2 wide. Also, price dropped from $140+ to $80 +. Cool color too. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BMF in Pa.

customer_reviews.title: Best low top local hikers
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Vasque boots since the mid 70's because they are extremely well built and have never disappointed me - and these low-top local hikers are no exception. The shoes fit perfectly, required no break-in and are as comfortable as an old friend. My only gripe is where they are made - China - for the price, they could be manufactured right here is the US, but I guess the investor is more important. Bottom line - for less than a-buck-and-a -quarter, these are are pretty good buy - spending more? - there are US manufacturers that make a better hiker.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Witt

customer_reviews.title: nothing major) and they wore very nicely. I like that the shoelace loops aren't just ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the 10.5 EE size and they fit as expected. Not sure about the answered question that said no wide option was available in the Gore-Tex model. Wore them to work a few times to break them in, although they probably didn't need it. Went on a few day hikes (3-5 miles each, nothing major) and they wore very nicely. I like that the shoelace loops aren't just nylon straps that can break unexpectedly, not that the leather loops can't but I'd think these are more robust. I also like having the metal top loops- a sign of quality if you ask me. I would not hesitate to recommend these or buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: jdoug

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have used these before and always have had good luck with the brand. A little bit tight,would get one half size larger next time. All in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: john j.

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toebox
customer_reviews.text: The toebox is narrow and the recommendation was to go up 1/2 size. Ordered a 12 and should have gone 11.5. Waited too late to return to them. Guess they're going to goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: David Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday caasual use
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have found that I can buy Vasque hiking shoes and wear them without a problem. They are comfortable for city walking and walking on nature trails. If you going on serious hiking trails, I would get some with a stiffer sole.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Buy these ones.
customer_reviews.text: Used these while hiking in Alaska and Montana this summer. Shoes held up great and are super comfortable. I ordered a size larger based upon other reviews. Once they arrived I thought they were too large, but I quickly broke them in and I was glad I ordered a size up from my usual shoe size. These are more comfortable than my regular tennis shoes (not that I play tennis).
customer_reviews.author: Todd Leroux

customer_reviews.title: nicely made and looks great, flexible
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Vasque and wearing different model now. I'm looking for a backpacking rock protection type sole so this model wasn't what I was looking for. I know I'm trading off no break in and less weight.
customer_reviews.author: JKH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable weather ready shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something casual to wear on rainy days. I have several pair of Vasque hiking boots and love them. These were a great addition. Low top is lighter, they look good, and water proof. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice waterproof shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair of these shoes. They are very rugged and last a long time, my first pair lasted nearly a year and a half. The waterproofing does wear off after about 7-8 months but I'm sure you could re-seal them if you wanted. The shoes do not breathe very well, but that is to be expected on a waterproof shoe. The leather holds up very well and the stitching never comes apart. I wore the sole down to nothing before anything else failed. I work in construction and put my shoes through hell and high water and these are the best ones I have found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Grand House

customer_reviews.title: Highest Recommendation!
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are awesome! Purchased an 11.5 size and they fit perfectly. Well made and extremely comfortable. Highest recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Frankledge

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from amazon after trying them on at local store. Locally they were $156 +tax so buy them here. They have a massive amount of room in toe box. To make them fit perfect I had to add thin layer of cork under insoles no biggie. The sole is really soft this makes them comfortable but would not expect more than a year of heavy daily use. Gore tex makes them a little hot in warm weather. overall good shoe
customer_reviews.author: Budget Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Feet feel awesome in these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have neuropathy in my feet and these shoes are awesome. They are very comfortable and never aggravate my feet. Gortex keeps your feet dry summer or winter which is the main reason I bought these shoes. If you have any issues with the feet gortex shoes are the answer.
customer_reviews.author: odell

customer_reviews.title: Durable Work Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes in construction. M-F I wear them around 10 hours a day and on the weekend about another 10 hours. I work on all types of surfaces, concrete, roofs, mud and rocky terrain. I've probably bought five pairs of these shoes. I've never had them get wet on the inside of the shoe. I beat on them pretty hard and I replace them after about 8 months. I do order a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: nathan r.

customer_reviews.title: excellent and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair of Vasque Mantra's that I have purchased for my husband. He wears them as his daily shoe and loves how durable they are. He usually "blows out" hiking shoes because of how wide his feet are. I purchased 12W and they fit great. The 1st pair was purchased 3/2017 and lasted until this year, 12/2019
customer_reviews.author: teacher & mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kicks
customer_reviews.text: Really like the shoes as this is my second pair with the only difference being width - went wide. Shoes are comfortable and soles last about a year of daily use before being completely shot. The only negative is they are very slippery on damn concrete surfaces, especially with diesel fuel. Heck, maybe all shoes are.
customer_reviews.author: T Y Singer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove, but with ample toe box space.
customer_reviews.text: Very, very comfortable! I wear a Men’s 11 and have narrow feet - like a B or C. This shoe feels just right in the width. Good arch support and support for feet in general. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Visitor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Vasque GoreTex hiking shoes. First pair still in good condition after 8 years of wear. These new shoes are comfortable and fit well. Used them on Colorado vacation and they kept my feet dry while slushing in snow and wading streams. I wear size 7.5 but ordered an 8. A 7.5 would have fit perfectly; so, go with your standard foot size. These fit fine by stuffing some foam in toe box. Definitely recommend...
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a joy to put on each and every day. It is well made and looks like no other. Could not be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: Marine 1

customer_reviews.title: True to size/fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Vasque lows and fit was as expected. A little early for a real review since I’ve not had them long. Quality and fit is very good so far
customer_reviews.author: mcgawb

customer_reviews.title: great everyday, all around shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the same pair twice now, great everyday, all around shoe. My only complaint is that the pair I received this time seems to have an internal squeak, which is annoying. I hoped it would go away over time but is has remained.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Vibram sole
customer_reviews.text: My standard for day hikes. The Vibram sole gives it durability, the deep-tread soles, stabilty on steep inclines. Overall a comfortable shoe at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Great ahie
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this shoe. Gives him the support he needs. He said it comfortable. This seems to be the only shoe he likes and it does hurt his feel or back
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve known about Vasque since the early 90’s when a friend had a pair of boots. These are cool looking and comfortable. Nice pair of low cut gore-Tex hiking shoes. Fits true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Bogart

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe for a Picky Guy
customer_reviews.text: I went thru 3 similar type shoes before finding satisfaction with this shoe. Very supportive but comfortable like a sneaker. Good looking, too. I look forward to wearing them out.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Vajda

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Whether you are hiking in the woods or around your warehouse office space these shoes fit the terrain. These shoes are well made and are rugged. I had to purchase the 2EE for my wider feet but as soon as I slipped the shoes on they felt good. My wife has had Vasque hiking boots in the past and really loved them. I purchased these shoes on her recommendation and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Webber

customer_reviews.title: fantastic shoes. I own 2 pairs of these now
customer_reviews.text: fantastic shoes. I own 2 pairs of these now, the older pair I use for yard work, some hiking, biking, etc. The newer pair I wear to work, out, etc. These are VERY well made and have lasted me well. I tend to wear out shoes in about a month or two with all the walking I do, and these things are going on a year now with no signs of problems.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Faber

customer_reviews.title: Darn good shoe
customer_reviews.text: First off, these run a bit tight. I normally do not need to by wide, so if you are perhaps borderline like me, then go with a wide size to play it safe. Next, these are comfy (once you get the right size). Warm too! I would buy them again. I was a little worried as I could see some glue marks, but that has not impaired the water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: E. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: I have wide feet and the shoe fits nicely. It is heavier than average shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this shoe. I have wide feet and the shoe fits nicely. It is heavier than average shoes, but I was looking for a sturdy well made waterproof hiking sneaker. This shoe just works and I walked through snow and puddles without any issue. I usually like to wait a longer period before reviewing a shoe, but I thought it would be nice to post the review while winter was still taking place. Vasque is a brand I will keep in mind going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H. Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet :-)
customer_reviews.text: Never wore a wider shoe than the Vasque Mantra 2.0 but I got to say they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. I loved them so much I ordered another pair to wear for casual and now wear the 1st pair for work. I am so glad I tried these shoes and I will continue to buy another pair when these 2 are worn out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking the Camino Santiago
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the high tops version and these are more comfortable and cooler. Sturdier than Moabs too. I'm now on my second pair. Great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Challenger

customer_reviews.title: they're light comfortable and feel like they can take quite the beating
customer_reviews.text: I was doubting buying these online because I've always had trouble fitting shoes. But I ordered mine based on size chart and they fit perfectly. As for the shoe, they're light comfortable and feel like they can take quite the beating. The only thing I'm going to change are the laces. They feel somewhat "light" for what the shoe can take. I've been wearing these daily for the last two weeks on dirt, gravel, asphalt, grass and my feet stayed comfortable all day. Great shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: No More Blue Socks
customer_reviews.text: Truly waterproof boots. I use these when applying lawn chemicals that contain blue marker dye. With other "waterproof” boots my socks would be dyed blue. When I wear these boots, my socks stay white because there is absolutely no leakage. They are comfortable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: SRW

customer_reviews.title: Too a leap of faith
customer_reviews.text: I used to sell shoes so buying them without trying them on made me uneasy. Turns out that it was rather easy and the shoes worked out very well.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, ample width and comfortable for long, continuous wear/use.
customer_reviews.text: They are lightweight and comfortable for continuous wear through full day activity. I got size 12 wide, and though length-wise they seem half-a size longer (than what I needed), the width has been perfect. They go well with casual attire off the trails. The waterproofing was adequate for the light drizzle that I did encounter; I have not waded through streams, with these on, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ghaniawala

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The left shoe makes a fabric popping noise as your step transitions through the toe. I'm not sure if this is normal, but it's annoying to me. Hearing my own shoe making noise as I walk takes the serenity out of a hike. Also my big toe hits the end of the left shoe and it very uncomfortable. I do like how well it's made seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: XCTreker

customer_reviews.title: If you like wet cold feat
customer_reviews.text: If you like wet cold feat, these shoes are for you. Any moister including perspiration that gets inside stays inside. My basic sneakers perform better.
customer_reviews.author: AAron G.

customer_reviews.title: My Initial thoughts...
customer_reviews.text: My initial thoughts are... Fit was as expected. Very comfortable out of the box and not clunky like other hiking shoes I've owned. Will update review after initial break in period and some use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Only for narrow feet, even the wide sizes
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these boots. Vasque makes quality products and the boots appeared to be built very well. The problem is that even their double wide size was wayyyyy too skinny for my feet. I typically wear 12.5W in american sizes, and their 13double wide was still entirely too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: CZR

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and zero break in time
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. These shoes stand up to mowing for over a year with no breakdown of materials. No other shoe in 17 years of doing this job has lasted the year. Grass kills shoes! This business should be a proving ground for shoes. Day in and day out always wet and covered in grass and mud and rain. Even the laces are in tact! These are still going strong half way into the second year. They got a little long but just barely. Very comfortable and zero break in time.
customer_reviews.author: george whalen

customer_reviews.title: CVS: Comfort, Value and Service
customer_reviews.text: The hiking boot is a quality product especially with Gore-Tex fabric which definitely keeps the feet dry in wet conditions. This is my second pair. I volunteer for the US Forest Service during the summer months and log several hundred miles of hiking on mountain trails. These boots are durable and comfortable under any conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Hoke

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe Company
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Light weight and very comfortable. I love Vasque!! Great shoe company
customer_reviews.author: R. Stanworth

customer_reviews.title: I love the comfort and support so much I wear them ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a pair of hikers that are light enough and attractive enough to wear as a daily shoe for inclimate weather. The Vasque Mantra truly fits the bill. I love the comfort and support so much I wear them anytime a casual shoe is appropriate. They are fairly new, and seem very well made so I hope they hold up to daily abuse!
customer_reviews.author: CJV

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Vasque has never failed me. Hiking in all terrains in the United states, and other countries. This is my second pair after being foolish and trying others before i gave into the more expensive vasque. The only reason they will fail is because i hiked to much! Love these shoes! Vasque, gore-tex, and vibram combination is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Venuso

customer_reviews.title: I like the shank
customer_reviews.text: Quality shoe. Well made. I like the shank, which makes walking on rocks more comfortable. I use my orthotics, so have lots of support - can't say how stock inserts are. Moded Vasque sole probably can't be resoled, though.
customer_reviews.author: sweater

customer_reviews.title: Good trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good hiking shoes, great traction on the trails. The shoes tend to wear out quickly around ankle area as fabric gets torn. Nevertheless, it’s comfortable and I’ve reorder them few times.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Hands down one, if not the BEST,  boots I have ever purchased!!!! 5 stars!! Highly recommended!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one, if not the BEST boots I have ever purchased!!!! 5 stars!! Highly recommended!!!! These boots are absolutely AWESOME!! I cannot say enough about them. They look and feel fantastic. I love them and would buy another pair without hesitation. They exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for daily wear and they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Creigh S.

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow! They were marked 13 Wide but ...
customer_reviews.text: Way too narrow! They were marked 13 Wide but were much narrower in the toe box than my Cabela's 13 EE boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: which is f'ing AWESOME! Only non-hiking / casual (or semi-formal
customer_reviews.text: Only place I've found who still carries this model shoe... which is f'ing AWESOME! Only non-hiking / casual (or semi-formal, depending upon the situation) shoe I own... and have a couple pairs in reserve. :)
customer_reviews.author: P-Dog

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, subtle, good quality hiking shoe at the right price...
customer_reviews.text: My first impression is that this is a quality hiking shoe, in a nice faded, dark green color. It is comfortable, but relatively narrow or snug width (typical of Vasque), which I like better for my feet. I was debating between this and the Patagonia Drifter GTX, but found the Vasque to be more attractive/subtle, and without what seems to be an anti-friction material inside the Patagonia which makes it feel a little bit slippery. Also, this one has a gusseted (sp?) tongue which prevents material from getting inside. Unfortunately this and practically every other hiking shoe is made in China nowadays, not the US, but then again the price is right (here at least!). Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof low comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, I wear these everyday for work and they keep my feet dry from wet lawns and are still breathable so my feet are not hot during the summer. I ordered a wide accidentally but they still fit pretty well with some extra room in the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO FIT MY FOOT
customer_reviews.text: LIKE THE SHOES. I HAVE ANOTHER PAIR OF VASQUE BREEZE THAT ARE A D WIDTH AND ARE TIGHT IN THE TOE BOX I ORDERD A WIDE WIIDTH. THESE ARE A BETTER FIT, BUT NOT MUCH WIDER. I WISH I COULD GET A BETTER FIT IN VASQUE SHOES. I REALLY LIKE THEIR PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from Asia and this shoe was perfect for the tropical weather and damp conditions .. Great buy for a shoe for all-around performance.
customer_reviews.author: Huey12

customer_reviews.title: These are the shoes you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Vasque shoes; previously, I was a Merrell fan. I always liked having a low-cut waterproof shoe for bad rain days, since we have a lot of those in Texas. These shoes have great Vibram soles and Gore-Tex lining. And so comfy I could wear them right away for extended times. Other good brands have gotten worse over time; you know who they are. These are so good I hope they will be my next pair of shoes too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scharold

customer_reviews.title: True Fit.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, comfortable. Laces could be a little heavier duty, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: You need these
customer_reviews.text: Very durable..! On my second pair in the last several years. I wear them almost every day. Made to last, comfortable and the Vibram sole just doesn’t wear out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MindOverMatter

customer_reviews.title: That was a great boot in its day and I have never worn ...
customer_reviews.text: I got my first pair of Vasque back in the late 1970's. They were the original Frankenstein looking hiking boots that we used to put Snowseal on to waterproof. That was a great boot in its day and I have never worn anything but Vasque since. They take a beating for years (my most recent pair lasted 10 years). My use is hiking. Colorado up and down trails can test a shoe over time and Vasque passes all tests. Fit as expected. Comfortable. Minimal break-in period. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. So good that I just received my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. So good that I just received my second pair after getting a 1 year and 6 months out of the first pair. Now I wear these just about every day at work and home. I camp in them, hike in them, tread through snow and drive a stick shift. Overall great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got the shoe was a little narrow for me had to return it but it was a good Quality product
customer_reviews.author: MJ

product_meta.title: Vasque Men's Mantra 2.0 Gore-Tex Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
A nubuck-and-mesh combination upper creates an attractive and durable mid-height hiking shoe.



Men's Mantra 2.0 GTX Hiking ShoeForm meets function with this modern hiking shoe by Vasque. The Mantra 2.0 gives you stability-providing midsoles, quality Vibram Nuasi outsoles, and durable nubuck and mesh uppers. The Mantra's Perpetuum last creates a comfort fit that makes it highly suitable for long-distance hikes. Available with or without a Gore-Tex liner, it's ready for walks in the park or walks into the wild.

COMFORT FIT FOR LONG-DISTANCE HIKES
As the name suggests, the Mantra's Perpetuum last creates a fit for steady, long-distance endeavors. The straighter line of this last is comfortable for people with flatter feet, while the tailored instep and lower-volume heel keeps your foot securely in place. It also features a wider toe box to accommodate natural foot expansion during 10K, 50K, or even 100K runs.

VIBRAM OUTSOLES FOR QUALITY AND DURABILITY
The Mantra 2.0 features a Vibram Nuasi outsole that gives you the durability you need for long-distance hiking. Partners for many years, Vasque works with Vibram to produce quality soles with innovative designs. The nubuck and mesh uppers increase the durability and comfort of this shoe.

GORE-TEX VERSION AVAILABLE
A GTX version of the Mantra is available with Gore-Tex waterproof technology. The breathable GORE-TEX membrane, water repellent laces, and seam sealing technology keep water and moisture out, ensuring a comfortable, relaxing hike--whatever the weather. 

AT A GLANCE
• Quality Vibram Nuasi outsole for durability
• Perpetuum last creates comfort fit for long distances
• Gore-Tex version available for all-weather hiking
• Weighs 2 pounds, 5 ounces (1,054g)
ABOUT VASQUE
Vasque is committed to making functional, innovative, and aesthetic footwear that performs to the highest standards. Founded by recreation enthusiast William D. Sweasy in 1965, Vasque has been producing high-quality mountaineering and hiking boots for over forty years. From the original Voyageur boot to today's technically innovative and stylish designs, the Vasque trail continues today, breaking new ground toward what's next.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Vasque Men's Mantra 2.0 GTX Hiking Shoes.

Women's Specific FitFormed on a last adjusted to fit women's specificallyWidthsRange of widths to address various foot shapes and sizes

At Vasque, they are committed to making functional, innovative and aesthetic footwear that performs to the highest standards. Their ultimate goal is to make shoes that inspire you to get outdoors and embark on an adventure. Incorporating and developing new and innovative technologies into their boots is what keeps Vasque at the top of their game.

See more
feature_bullets: Low-cut hiking shoe with the same stability and grip of a backpacking boot
GORE-TEX with Extended Comfort Technology for breathable waterproof protection
1.8mm Nubuck leather upper with abrasion resistant mesh for breathability and durability
Speed lacing system for comfortable fit and performance hiking
Vibram Nuassi outsole with XSTrek Compound for trail traction
